question_text:
This graph shows how the number of cakes Haley can bake is related to the number of additional eggs she buys.

What is the rate of change? Write your answer as a decimal or integer.

_cakes per egg
solution:
The rate of change is equal to the slope.
slope = $\frac{\text{change in y}}{\text{change in x}}$
Find any two points on the line.

Two points on the line are (0, 40) and (40, 70). Put those points into the slope formula.
slope = $\frac{\text{change in y}}{\text{change in x}}$
 =$ \frac{70 - 40}{40 - 0}$  (Plug in (0, 40) and (40, 70))
= $\frac{30}{40}$  (Subtract)
= $\frac{3}{4}$  (Simplify)
= $0.75$  (Write as a decimal)
The slope is 0.75. The rate of change is 0.75 cakes per egg.
solution_image_tag: The image shows a line graph titled Cakes baked, with the x-axis labeled Number of additional eggs and the y-axis labeled Number of cakes. A black line extends diagonally and passes through two red points at coordinates (0, 40) and (40, 70). These points represent the relationship between the number of additional eggs Haley buys and the number of cakes she can bake. The graph is used to determine the constant rate of change, which is calculated by comparing the vertical change in cakes to the horizontal change in eggs between the two points.

question_text:
This graph shows how the number of pastries Evelyn can make is related to the number of additional dough she buys.

What is the rate of change? Write your answer as a decimal or integer.

_ pastries per dough
solution:
The rate of change is equal to the slope.
slope = $\frac{\text{change in y}}{\text{change in x}}$
Find any two points on the line.

Two points on the line are (15, 58) and (55, 130). Put those points into the slope formula.
slope = $\frac{\text{change in y}}{\text{change in x}}$
 = $\frac{130 - 58}{55 - 15}$ (Plug in (15, 58) and (55, 130))
= $\frac{72}{40}$ (Subtract)
= $\frac{9}{5}$ (Simplify)
= $1.8$
The slope is 1.8. The rate of change is 1.8 pastries per dough.

A black line extends diagonally and passes through two red points at coordinates (15, 58) and (55, 130). These points represent the relationship between the number of additional dough Evelyn buys and the number of pastries she can make. The graph is used to determine the constant rate of change, which is calculated by comparing the vertical change in pastries to the horizontal change in dough between the two points.

question_text:

What is the rate of change? Write your answer as a decimal or integer.

solution:
The rate of change is equal to the slope.
slope = $\frac{\text{change in y}}{\text{change in x}}$
Find any two points on the line.

Two points on the line are (20, 52) and (60, 312). Put those points into the slope formula.
slope = $\frac{\text{change in y}}{\text{change in x}}$
 = $\frac{312 - 52}{60 - 20}$ (Plug in (20, 52) and (60, 312))
= $\frac{260}{40}$ (Subtract)
= $\frac{13}{2}$ (Simplify)
= $6.5$
The slope is 6.5. The rate of change is 6.5 cookies per chips.

question_text:

solution:
The rate of change is equal to the slope.
slope = $\frac{\text{change in y}}{\text{change in x}}$
Find any two points on the line.

Two points on the line are (5, 54) and (40, 167). Put those points into the slope formula.
slope = $\frac{\text{change in y}}{\text{change in x}}$
 = $\frac{167 - 54}{40 - 5}$ (Plug in (5, 54) and (40, 167))
= $\frac{113}{35}$ (Subtract)
= $3.25$
The slope is 3.25. The rate of change is 3.25 cinnamon buns per powder.

slope = $\frac{\text{change in y}}{\text{change in x}}$
 = $\frac{50 - 34}{50 - 10}$ (Plug in (10, 34) and (50, 50))
= $\frac{16}{40}$ (Subtract)
= $\frac{2}{5}$ (Simplify)
= $0.4$
The slope is 0.4. The rate of change is 0.4 naan bread per containers.

What is the rate of change? Write your answer as a decimal or integer.

_ pita bread per packets
solution:
The rate of change is equal to the slope.
slope = $\frac{\text{change in y}}{\text{change in x}}$
Find any two points on the line.

Two points on the line are (15, 35) and (55, 595). Put those points into the slope formula.
slope = $\frac{\text{change in y}}{\text{change in x}}$
 = $\frac{595 - 35}{55 - 15}$ (Plug in (15, 35) and (55, 595))
= $14$

question_text:
This graph shows how the number of tortillas Layla can make is related to the number of additional masa flour she buys.

What is the rate of change? Write your answer as a decimal or integer.

_ tortillas per flour
solution:
The rate of change is equal to the slope.
slope = $\frac{\text{change in y}}{\text{change in x}}$
Find any two points on the line.

Two points on the line are (0, 52) and (40, 202). Put those points into the slope formula.
slope = $\frac{\text{change in y}}{\text{change in x}}$
 = $\frac{202 - 52}{40 - 0}$ (Plug in (0, 52) and (40, 202))
= $\frac{150}{40}$ (Subtract)
= $\frac{15}{4}$ (Simplify)
= $3.75$
The slope is 3.75. The rate of change is 3.75 tortillas per flour.

question_text:
This graph shows how the number of crackers Owen can make is related to the number of additional seed mix he buys.

What is the rate of change? Write your answer as a decimal or integer.

_ crackers per mix
solution:
The rate of change is equal to the slope.
slope = $\frac{\text{change in y}}{\text{change in x}}$
Find any two points on the line.

Two points on the line are (0, 37) and (25, 143). Put those points into the slope formula.
slope = $\frac{\text{change in y}}{\text{change in x}}$
 = $\frac{143 - 37}{25 - 0}$ (Plug in (0, 37) and (25, 143))
= $\frac{106}{25}$ (Subtract)
= $4.25$
The slope is 4.25. The rate of change is 4.25 crackers per mix.

question_text:
This graph shows how the number of pretzels Riley can make is related to the number of additional lye solution she buys.

What is the rate of change? Write your answer as a decimal or integer.

_ pretzels per solution
solution:
The rate of change is equal to the slope.
slope = $\frac{\text{change in y}}{\text{change in x}}$
Find any two points on the line.

Two points on the line are (10, 39) and (35, 104). Put those points into the slope formula.
slope = $\frac{\text{change in y}}{\text{change in x}}$
 = $\frac{104 - 39}{35 - 10}$ (Plug in (10, 39) and (35, 104))
= $\frac{65}{25}$ (Subtract)
= $\frac{13}{5}$ (Simplify)
= $2.6$
The slope is 2.6. The rate of change is 2.6 pretzels per solution.
